titleStmt.title: Grant Green to James F. Robinson
CWG8698

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky
Frankfort, 14th February, 1863.
, Esq.:
Dear Sir:
His Excellency
Govr Robinson
Dear Sir

The Shff of Larue County for 18631 J W Larue has paid the amount in full of the principal interest and costs owe by him as Sheriff of said County for said year. A Judgment was rendered against him & his secruities at the Feb term 1862 of the Franklin Circuit Court for $1422.18 principal, with interest from the 1st day of June 1861. and $28443 Damages. There was trouble in this County, and the Revenue was paid as promptly as it could well be done.

Franklin Cir. Ct
$284.43. } Damages
J. W. Larue
Sheriff of Larue Co
Remission Issd
Feby 14th 1863
